summary:
-Philosophy Research Master's student with a focus in climate change policy, political philosophy, and democratic decision-making processes. 

-Internationally focused professional with multifaceted work experience including climate change policy research, bioethics, speechwriting, certified ESL education, and gastronomy (in a previous life). 
 
Academic research areas include: 
      -Philosophy of Climate Change: How should we assess mitigation and adaptation strategies for  
      AGW? Is it possible to sufficiently address AGW within a neoliberal economic framework, and if so, 
      what reforms would this entail? How can we effectively transition into a sustainable future that still 
      meets our energy needs? How might experts best communicate pertinent climate information to 
      political leaders and members of the public?   
      -Political Epistemology: How might political information be best accessed by a democratic public? What      
      are the necessary conditions for public self-governance in the modern age? What would this look like in 
      practice? How can democratic nations address the challenges of anthropogenic global warming (AGW)? 
      What is the relation between expert knowledge and public opinion?
     -Discourse Theory: What are fallacies, and how might bad faith actors abuse them to manipulate other 
      peoples' worldviews? How does propaganda and biased research harm AGW discourse, and what are 
      the political impacts of this? How can public discourse bring discussants and listeners closer to a 
      functional understanding of important public issues? What important aspects of AGW are omitted from 
      public discourse, and why?

-Fluent in English, conversational (strong A2) in Dutch, beginner in Czech.

profile_positions.description:
Provide lectures and run thesis peer-review sessions for bachelor's students in the Theoretical Philosophy faculty, with consistent positive feedback from students and superiors

-Responsible for instructing a mandatory course organized around strengthening students’ writing skills and tackling large scale academic research projects
-Guide students through the entire process of writing a philosophy thesis, from identifying promising questions to polishing the final draft
-Offer a human touch to a potentially daunting task by breaking down the project into manageable chunks
-Holistically address all possible problems a bachelor’s student faces in this endeavor, including not just aspects of academic writing, but also emotional and psychological difficulties surrounding independent academic research
profile_positions.title: Thesis Writing Instructor

profile_positions.description:
-Conducted face to face interviews with diverse members of the community to obtain sensitive census data.
-Worked closely with a professional team to coordinate practical solutions to logistical problems related to collecting census information.
-Interfaced with proprietary federal software to accurately record census data.
profile_positions.title: Census Enumerator

profile_positions.description:
Recruited to be an integral part of the start-up team for a high-end Australian gastropub in the heart of Prague
-Quickly advanced from fry cook to Sous Chef/kitchen supervisor 
-Due to staff shortage assumed role of supervising back of house operations including order preparation for raw ingredients, staff training on proper food preparation and handling, final dish presentation, kitchen safety and sanitary standards
-Mastered the Australian gastronomy menu and created new weekly menu specials
-Utilized Czech language skills to communicate in a fast-paced multi-lingual environment
profile_positions.title: Sous Chef / Kitchen Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
Certified ESL instructor in Czechia, specializing in both business English and English for Specific 
-Designed and taught curriculums focused on Geopolitics, Global Economics, Technical Writing, Legal --Cases, Academia and Aviation Regulation
-Instructed professionals working within the Civil Aviation Authority who were responsible for converting Czech laws to comply with European Commission regulations. Students included attorneys, judges, architects, IT staff, legislators, and professors
-Provided advanced grammar and ESL coaching in 1:1 and classroom settings for beginner to near fluent English speakers
profile_positions.title: TEFL Certified ESL Instructor

profile_positions.description:
Managed the front desk of the Collaborative for Community Engagement, a group dedicated to enriching interconnection within the Colorado Springs community.
-Wrote blog posts detailing cleanup efforts of the Monument Creek watershed in downtown Colorado Springs.  Transcribed and edited communications with other top tier universities to streamline efforts within our own organization.
-Communicated with multiple local nonprofit organizations to assist with community outreach and resource acquisition.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Direct report to head of Bioethics Department who drafted and got passed key ethics healthcare legislation
-Developed and drafted executive level research analysis on the relationship between advancing healthcare technology and policy implementation.  Created keynote speech/presentation given at a nationally recognized Bioethics technology conference by a Senior Vice President from research analysis
profile_positions.title: Policy / Research Analysis Intern and Speechwriter

profile_positions.description:
-Conducted biological forestry surveys on the island of Nosy Be, Madagascar.
-Visually identified numerous reptiles, lemurs, butterflies, and birds for environmental data purposes and to assess environmental health of a fragile and rapidly disappearing ecosystem.
-Participated in scuba diving excursions to remote aquatic locations in order to conduct coral reef health assessments.
profile_positions.title: Field Research Assistant

skills: Teaching English as a Second Language
